title: Editor's Choice Pictures
text:
Pictures | Thu Apr 19, 2018 | 9:55am   
Pink flamingos frolic in their enclosure at the Madrid zoo in Madrid, Spain. REUTERS/Paul Hanna Reuters / Wednesday, April 18, 2018 Pink flamingos frolic in their enclosure at the Madrid zoo in Madrid, Spain. REUTERS/Paul Hanna Close 1 / 24 
A   2   3 / 24 
U.S. Navy Lieutenant Tammie Jo Shults, who is currently a Southwest Airlines pilot, poses in front of a Navy F/A-18A in this 1992 photo released in Washington, DC. Thomas P. Milne/U.S. Navy/Handout via REUTERS Reuters / Wednesday, April 18, 2018 U.S. Navy Lieutenant Tammie Jo Shults, who is currently a Southwest Airlines pilot, poses in front of a Navy F/A-18A in this 1992 photo released in Washington, DC. Thomas P. Milne/U.S. Navy/Handout via REUTERS Close 4 / 24 
Spanish big wave surfer Axi Muniain drops in on a large wave at Praia do Norte in Nazare, Portugal. REUTERS/Rafael Marchante Reuters / Wednesday, April 18, 2018 Spanish big wave surfer Axi Muniain drops in on a large wave at Praia do Norte in Nazare, Portugal. REUTERS/Rafael Marchante Close 5 / 24 
Palestinian cyclist Alaa Al-Daly, 21, who lost his leg by a bullet fired by Israeli troops, stands next to his bicycle at his house in Rafah, southern Gaza Strip. REUTERS/Suhaib Salem Reuters / Wednesday, April 18, 2018 Palestinian cyclist Alaa Al-Daly, 21, who lost his leg by a bullet fired by Israeli troops, stands next to his bicycle at his house in Rafah, southern Gaza Strip. REUTERS/Suhaib Salem Close 6 / 24 
An aerial view shows erosion marks on sand and stone, on the beach along the Atlantic Ocean coast, in Soulac, France. REUTERS/Regis Duvignau Reuters / Wednesday, April 18, 2018 An aerial view shows erosion marks on sand and stone, on the beach along the Atlantic Ocean coast, in Soulac, France. REUTERS/Regis Duvignau Close 7 / 24 
U.S. NTSB photo shows a part of the engine cowling from the Southwest Airlines plane which blew its engine in mid air yesterday over the skies of Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. NTSB/Handout via REUTERS Reuters / Wednesday, April 18, 2018 U.S. NTSB photo shows a part of the engine cowling from the Southwest Airlines plane which blew its engine in mid air yesterday over the skies of Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. NTSB/Handout via REUTERS Close 8 / 24 
Carl Frampton is seen posing through a mirror after a press conference in Victoria Square Shopping Centre, Belfast, Britain. Action Images via Reuters/Jason Cairnduff Reuters / Wednesday, April 18, 2018 Carl Frampton is seen posing through a mirror after a press conference in Victoria Square Shopping Centre, Belfast, Britain. Action Images via Reuters/Jason Cairnduff Close 9 / 24 
Britain's Prime Minister Theresa May welcomes Canada's   to 10 Downing Street in London, Britain. REUTERS/Toby Melville Reuters / Wednesday, April 18, 2018 Britain's Prime Minister Theresa May welcomes Canada's   to 10 Downing Street in London, Britain. REUTERS/Toby Melville Close 10 / 24 
Mohamed Khalifa Al Mubarak, Chairman of Abu Dhabi Tourism and Culture Authority speaks during a media preview of Warner Bros. World Abu Dhabi theme park in Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates. REUTERS/Christopher Pike Reuters / Wednesday, April 18, 2018 Mohamed Khalifa Al Mubarak, Chairman of Abu Dhabi Tourism and Culture Authority speaks during a media preview of Warner Bros. World Abu Dhabi theme park in Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates. REUTERS/Christopher Pike Close 11 / 24 
Former FBI Director James Comey arrives to speak about his book "A Higher Loyalty" in New York. REUTERS/Lucas Jackson Reuters / Wednesday, April 18, 2018 Former FBI Director James Comey arrives to speak about his book "A Higher Loyalty" in New York. REUTERS/Lucas Jackson Close 12 / 24 
Igor, the 13 year-old Siberian tiger lies on the operation table before the non-invasive stem cell surgery in Zoo Szeged, Hungary. REUTERS/Bernadett Szabo Reuters / Wednesday, April 18, 2018 Igor, the 13 year-old Siberian tiger lies on the operation table before the non-invasive stem cell surgery in Zoo Szeged, Hungary. REUTERS/Bernadett Szabo Close 13 / 24 
A bead of sweat drops off of Spain's Rafael Nadal as he prepares to serve during his second round match against Slovenia's Aljaz Bedene during the Monte Carlo Masters. REUTERS/Eric Gaillard Reuters / Wednesday, April 18, 2018 A bead of sweat drops off of Spain's Rafael Nadal as he prepares to serve during his second round match against Slovenia's Aljaz Bedene during the Monte Carlo Masters. REUTERS/Eric Gaillard Close 14 / 24 
A Muslim prays at the Elsedeaq Heidelberg Mosque, located in the Melbourne suburb of Heidelberg in Australia. REUTERS/Luis Enrique Ascui Reuters / Wednesday, April 18, 2018 A Muslim prays at the Elsedeaq Heidelberg Mosque, located in the Melbourne suburb of Heidelberg in Australia. REUTERS/Luis Enrique Ascui Close 15 / 24 
German Chancellor Angela Merkel smiles as she attends the weekly cabinet meeting at the chancellery in Berlin, Germany. REUTERS/Hannibal Hanschke Reuters / Wednesday, April 18, 2018 German Chancellor Angela Merkel smiles as she attends the weekly cabinet meeting at the chancellery in Berlin, Germany. REUTERS/Hannibal Hanschke Close 16 / 24 
Limar and Masa al-Qari, child survivors of the suspected poison gas attack, walk outside a tent for the displaced, in the Northern Aleppo countryside, Syria. REUTERS/Mahmoud Hassano Reuters / Wednesday, April 18, 2018 Limar and Masa al-Qari, child survivors of the suspected poison gas attack, walk outside a tent for the displaced, in the Northern Aleppo countryside, Syria. REUTERS/Mahmoud Hassano Close 17 / 24 
Britain's Prince Harry's fiancee Meghan Markle attends a reception with delegates from the Commonwealth Youth Forum at the Queen Elizabeth II Conference Centre, London. Yui Mok/Pool   Wednesday, April 18, 2018 Britain's Prince Harry's fiancee Meghan Markle attends a reception with delegates from the Commonwealth Youth Forum at the Queen Elizabeth II Conference Centre, London. Yui Mok/Pool via Reuters Close 18 / 24 
Surfers ride a wave near the cliffs of Etretat on the Normandy coast as warm temperatures arrive in France. REUTERS/Pascal Rossignol Reuters / Wednesday, April 18, 2018 Surfers ride a wave near the cliffs of Etretat on the Normandy coast as warm temperatures arrive in France. REUTERS/Pascal Rossignol Close 19 / 24 
Tourists cross the Windsor Bridge in the British overseas territory of Gibraltar, historically claimed by Spain. REUTERS/Jon Nazca Reuters / Wednesday, April 18, 2018 Tourists cross the Windsor Bridge in the British overseas territory of Gibraltar, historically claimed by Spain. REUTERS/Jon Nazca Close 20 / 24 
An Israeli girl plays with an inflatable hammer during celebrations marking Israel's 70th Independence Day in the southern city of Ashkelon, Israel. REUTERS/Amir Cohen Reuters / Wednesday, April 18, 2018 An Israeli girl plays with an inflatable hammer during celebrations marking Israel's 70th Independence Day in the southern city of Ashkelon, Israel. REUTERS/Amir Cohen Close 
Workers stand on rubble of damaged buildings in Raqqa, Syria. REUTERS/Aboud Hamam Reuters / Wednesday, April 18, 2018 Workers stand on rubble of damaged buildings in Raqqa, Syria. REUTERS/Aboud Hamam Close 
Bill Gates speaks during an interview with Reuters in   McKay Reuters / Wednesday, April 18, 2018 Bill Gates speaks during an interview with Reuters in   McKay Close 23 / 24 
President Donald Trump and Japan's Prime Minister Shinzo Abe shake hands as they hold a joint press conference at Trump's Mar-a-Lago estate in Palm Beach, Florida. REUTERS/Kevin Lamarque Reuters / Wednesday, April 18, 2018 President Donald Trump and Japan's Prime Minister Shinzo Abe shake hands as they hold a joint press conference at Trump's Mar-a-Lago estate in Palm Beach, Florida. REUTERS/Kevin Lamarque Close
